en.course1SummaryTitle: Course Summary: Ethical and social behaviors: exploring the potential of data and AI
en.course1SummaryContent: This course explores how data and Artificial Intelligence can be used to analyze social phenomena, promoting critical reflection on their ethical implications. Aimed at Data Management students at UFPI and the general public, with a workload of 20 hours.
en.course1Meeting1Title: Lesson 1 ‚Äì What is Computational Social Sciences?
en.course1Meeting2Title: Lesson 2 ‚Äì Social Networks and the Structure of Human Relations
en.course1Meeting3Title: Lesson 3 ‚Äì Big Data, AI, and Ethics
en.course1Meeting5Title: Lesson 5 ‚Äì What do social data say about the world?
en.course1Meeting6Title: Lesson 6 - How am I read by algorithms?
en.servicesTitle: What I can do for you
en.service1Desc: I specialize in developing machine learning solutions that turn raw data into actionable insights. Whether you need predictive models, recommendation systems, or automation, I can help design, train, and optimize ML models tailored to your needs.
en.service2Desc: I develop and manage robust and scalable data pipelines, ensuring efficient and reliable data collection, processing, and availability to support analytics and machine learning applications.
en.service3Desc: I design, build, and deploy end-to-end Machine Learning systems, handling everything from model conception to monitoring and maintenance in production environments, ensuring performance and scalability.
en.service3Cta: üí° Ready to take your ML models to production?
en.service4Desc: I use data and computational tools to understand social structures and behaviors. Focusing on a critical and social perspective, I apply technologies like AI to analyze social phenomena and promote reflections on their use and ethical implications, transforming data into an understanding of social reality.
en.service4Cta: üåç Let's understand and transform society with data?
